metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6198 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The filesystem layer in the Linux kernel before 4.5.5 proceeds with post-rename operations after an OverlayFS file is renamed to a self-hardlink, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a rename system call, related to fs/namei.c and fs/open.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-41-generic - 4.2.0-41.48~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-41-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-41.48~14.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1

notes.Note: PHLin> patch 9409e22 got reverted in 8d3e2936 when 51f7e52 is applied

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
